title: Seriously We need to change Anivia's E interaction with R
body:
I'm fine if I get killed by failing to dodge her stun, that's ok, that's my own misplay.
But being able to burst half of my hp without aiming any skillshot is absolutely dumb.
You need to change her E to something like 1.5 damage with R  while the interaction with Q remains (or you can buff that idc) Otherwise this
http://imgur.com/btqiC2O
 is a lie.

It's really annoying when you dodged literaly every, single, Q from the enemy Anivia during the entire game and still get destroyed

Anivia is fine

She has to get relatively close to land E, 

And the nerf you are asking for already exsists 

The time frame to E is lower on R than it is Q because of the chilled duration, making it so you can run from E to escape the chilled effect of R to negate a lot of damage

30-40% of her damage (Q) is easily dodged skill shot
E when a target is chilled is 50% of her damage
R is the last 10% (unless you just sit in it for it to become more than 10%)

As a former anivia main, her laning pattern for poking people down is E -> R, not R -> E. You cast her ult while her E is in mid-air, making it impossible to miss the bonus damage. You can also pull off the combo with slightly less mana if your R would run you oom before you could toggle it off.

I used to play anivia a lot as well, most other mids out range her or have other ways to deal with it

LB for example can outmaneuver you

Zed can poke from greater range

Yas has a shield, mobility and a wall

Fizz has troll pole

And others either out range her our outburst her with CC to disrupt her combo

An adc in lane will likely get recked if they do t get ahead early or outrage her

Talon can burst her into an egg to get ahead early on

She isn't unstoppable and gets strong damage late game because a lot of her damage is in her E, which is single target and low range, so it being strong isn't unreasonable

But she's also extremely slow and squishy, which are appropriate weaknesses for her. I don't think she's overpowered or unhealthy at the moment.

that's because you didn't respect her field of influence. anivia doesn't have a big one, and if your not in her ult the frost doesn't apply for super long either. anivia is also really squish, and uses mana very quickly, play something to either outrange her or something that kills her multiple times in lane and you should do fine.

Pretty much this. They even recently reduced the cast range on it. If you are a melee, wait until she wastes her stun then go in. You get hit by one burst but if you play smart you should be able to stay out of her ultimate circle and do damage. The cooldowns on her abilities that amplify E damage are long enough to give you a window to defeat her. She has very strong counters.

Fun fact, the last time Anivia's damage was directly changed was when NASUS was released. Let that sink in for a minute. If it was truly an issue, don't you think it would have been dealt with by now?

Now, here is the thing about "difficulty" rating. By your logic, all difficulty should be based on the absolute EASIEST thing to do on a champion. If that was to be done, then ALL champions would be rated as stupidly easy. The difficulty bar more or less represents the effort it takes to become fully proficient with a given champion.

Now, if you are complaining about her E damage, then let me give you the exact numbers. Assuming max rank, her E deals 175 + 50% AP, this doubles on a target with the "chilled" debuff. Even if she uses her ult + E, the damage from that is actually not that impressive compared to other 2 spell combos.  Example, a Leblanc Q+W will deal more damage than Anivia ult+E unless you stand in the ult for an extended period of time.

Anivia's E trades strong stand alone strength for better synergy with her Q and ult. Leblanc Q, Akali Q, Zed ult, Yas ult, Syndra E and ult, and Ahri E are all examples of spells that alone are pretty lacking. However they become much stronger in usage with other spells. 

If you think Anivia's most difficult aspect is using E with ult, then that shows exactly how little you know of her.
